Label:
## Issue civil court proceedings
To use this service you must be:
* issuing a claim for an unspecified (unfixed) amount of money
* serving the claim yourself, with a UK postal address and an email address
* able to pay the full issue fee using payment by account
* issuing and conducting the claim in English
* representing a claimant who has no civil proceedings order, civil restraint order or all proceedings order against them
* representing a claimant who isn’t seeking Help With Fees

Both claimant and defendant must:
* have an address in England or Wales
* be 18 or older and not a protected party

The claim you’re issuing must not:
* ordinarily follow the Part 8 procedure
* be brought under the Consumer Credit Act 1974
* be against the crown

If this claim doesn't meet these conditions, select 'Cancel'
Claimant details
_Definition: The details of the first applicant on the case

Label: Defendant details
_Definition: The details of the first respondent on the case

Label: What type of claim is this?
What type of personal injury is this?
Statement of truth
_Definition: The statement of truth acknowledged by the first applicant solictor of the issue of the claim.

Label: Claim issued date
_Definition: The derived legal date the claim is deemed issued. It is based on the date time when the claim was submitted digitally

Label: How did you serve the documents?
_Definition: The delivery method type of service from the applicant solicitor to the first respondent solicitor

Label: Where did you serve the documents?
_Definition: The delivery location of service from the applicant solicitor to the first respondent solicitor

Label: When did you serve the documents?
_Definition: The actual date the claim was served by the applicant solicitor to the first respondent solicitor

Label: When did you serve the documents?
_Definition: The actual date time the claim was served by the applicant solicitor to the first respondent solicitor

Label: Statement of truth
_Definition: The statement of truth acknowledged by the applicant solictor of the service of the claim to the first respondent solicitor

Label: Deemed date of service
_Definition: The derived legal date the claim is deemed served to the first respondent solicitor. It is based on the date time when the claim was actually served

Label: Response deadline
_Definition: The date time by which the first respondent solicitor has to submit the response to the claim.

Label: Proposed new deadline
HintText: This can't be later than 28 working days after the current deadline. All deadlines require a response before 4pm on the deadline day.

Label: Have you already agreed the new deadline with the claimant's legal representative?
HintText: If not, you can propose it using this service.

Label: Reason why more time is needed.
HintText: This is mandatory - the claimant will see your answer.

Label: All deadlines require a response before 4pm on the deadline day
Do you agree to extend the deadline to this date?
Would you like to set a different extended deadline?
New deadline
HintText: This can't be later than 28 working days after the current deadline. All deadlines require a response before 23:59 on the deadline day.

Label: Response intention
_Definition: The intended response of the first respondent to the claim
